newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNISH SDP RETAINS CLEAR PRE-ELECTION LEAD - POLL.
newsitem.headline: FINNISH SDP RETAINS CLEAR PRE-ELECTION LEAD - POLL.

text.p: Support for Finland's leading
party, the Social Democrats, edged a shade higher ahead of local
government and European Parliament elections on October 20,
Finnish radio news reported on Friday.
An opinion survey by pollster Taloustutkimus Oy among 1,924
people of voting age between September 6 and October 7 put
support for Prime Minister Paavo Lipponen's SDP at 26.2 percent,
up 0.1 percentage point on a Taloustutkimus poll in August.
The biggest opposition group, ex-Prime Minister Esko Aho's
Centre Party, retreated one percentage point to 19.6 percent.
Recent Taloustutkimus opinion polls (figs in pct):
Sept Aug June May Parl 95 Local 92
Leftist Alliance 8.2 8.2 9.1 9.1 11.2 11.7
Young Finns 6.3 5.9 6.3 6.6 2.8 N/A
Swedish Party 4.5 4.1 4.1 4.8 5.1 5.0
Christian League 3.2 3.2 2.3 3.3 3.0 3.2
For the three biggest parties, the findings of the new
Taloustutkimus poll were broadly in line with a September 15-25
poll made by the Radar institute, which gave the SDP 26.6
percent, the Centre Party 20.4 percent and the Conservative
Party 19.6 percent.
The Radar poll gave the Leftist Alliance a higher rating
(10.5 pct) and measured lower support for the Green Party (7.0
pct) than Taloustutkimus.
--Helsinki Newsroom +358 - 0 - 680 50 245
